page.title: 09 Vauxhall Army Camp
page.content: Vauxhall camp has been used as a training camp for cadets,regular and territorial soldiers.Nearby are the Brecon Beacons which has proved a testing training area for the highly professional British Army. This year,Monmouth received some very bad news.The Ministry of Defence directed that the camp should close. This caused concern amongst local councillors as the visitors to the camp brought considerable revenue to the town. For centuries,Monmouth has been the home of the Royal Monmouthshire Royal Engineers.The Sargeants' Mess of the R.M.R.E. is situated on Vauxhall Camp and regular functions are held for the enjoyment of past and present members of the regiment.
